info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:37PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lincoln and McCormick Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 636 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nancy Hart State Park, or 10 miles east of Elberton, moving southeast at 40 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Strom Thurmond Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... McCormick, Lincolnton, Elijah Clark State Park, Mccormick County Airport, Lake Strom Thurmond, Bobby Brown State Park, Parksville, Plum Branch, Bordeaux, Knox Scout Reservation, Double Branches, Curry Hill, Chennault, New Hope, Long Cane Creek Picnic Area, Hickory Knob State Resort Park, Gill`s Point, Hester`s Ferry Campground, Mount Carmel, and Baker Creek State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
